result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera.  Attorney Ken Olstinski for Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense waives interpreter for this appearance only.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.  Court grants request and advises the parties any motions are due by December 1, 2022.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense waives interpreter for this appearance.  Defense requests adjourned scheduling date as she has her paralegal reviewing discovery with Defendant.  Court grants request.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Heather Johnson requested adjournment, via email, due to being in Trial in another Court.  No objection from State.  Court grants adjournment.  Both parties agreed to new Scheduling Conference date, via email.  Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference July 28, 2022, at 8:30 am.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Sworn as interpreter: Kelley Salas. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney H. Johnson does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility due to the non appearance of counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Johnson has intake and is unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Court ordered no contact with D.B.G and her two children
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.    If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carlos Enrique Diaz-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
